chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery (939.32 Attempt)(939.05 Party to a Crime)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Montrall T Doss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Theft-Movable Property-from Person >$10,000 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
In the Wisconsin State Prison System.
Consecutive to: any other sentence
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
If defendant serves his sentence in the WPS, costs to be paid from 25% of his prison funds and on extended supervision to convert to a civil judgment that is non-dischargeable in bankruptcy.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION OR EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Restitution set at zero.
AODA assessment and treatment with random urine screens.
Obtain HSED/GED. Seek and maintain employment and/or school. Job/vocational training. Cognitive thinking therapy.

Provide a DNA sample and pay appropriate costs.  Pay costs, fees and assessments and supervision fees to be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court costs to be paid while on probation to convert to a civil judgement that is non-dischargeable in bankruptcy.  If defendant serves his sentence in the WPS, costs to be paid from 25% of his prison funds and on extended supervision to convert to a civil judgment that is non-dischargeable in bankruptcy.
No controlled substances or alcohol. No contact with victim, Lamont W or co-defendant Calvin H.

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class G felony, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence with the following conditions to be met:
- follow all terms and conditions of probation
- follow all terms and conditions of PO agent
- pay all sums with no reduction to civil judgment.
- no new law violations rising to the level of probable cause

timeConds.notes: With Huber for work and school. Good time to apply Defendant's report date is 6-26-14 at 5:00 p.m.
STAYED. To be used at the discretion of the PO agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Montrall T Doss

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Montrall T Doss in court with attorney Bridget J Krause.  Kimberly Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  State has satisfied victim notification.  No restitution has been requested.  Filed with the court:  letters in support of the defendant.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be 4 years consecutive to any other sentence.  Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for 2 years with credit for 7 days time served.  Defendant shall serve 2 years on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.    The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  The Court advised the defendant of his determinate sentence pursuant to statute and in accordance with Form CR-234.  Copy provided to defendant. 
The Court STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 2.5 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION OR EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- no controlled substances or alcohol
- AODA assessment and treatment with random urine screens
- no contact with victim, Lamont W or co-defendant Calvin H.
- obtain HSED/GED
- restitution is set at zero
- seek and maintain employment and/or school
- job/vocational training
- cognitive thinking therapy
- provide a DNA sample and pay appropriate costs
- serve 4 months conditions time: 60 days in the HOC with huber for work and school and 60 days imposed and stayed to be used at the discretion of the PO agent.  Good time to apply.  Defendant report date is 6-26-2014 at 5:00 pm.
- pay costs, fees and assessments and supervision fees to be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court costs to be paid while on probation to convert to a civil judgement that is non-dischargeable in bankruptcy.  If defendant serves his sentence in the WPS, costs to be paid from 25% of his prison funds and on extended supervision to convert to a civil judgment that is non-dischargeable in bankruptcy.
Filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Sentencing Referral Form, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Appeal rights given.
Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class G felony, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence with the following conditions to be met:
- follow all terms and conditions of probation
- follow all terms and conditions of PO agent
- pay all sums with no reduction to civil judgment
- no new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
/from Justice Point, received and filed. rn

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.   Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue in this case and continued matter before Branch 20.

Defendant Montrall T Doss in court with attorney Bridget J Krause.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

/submitted by the State, charging defendant as follows:
Attempt Theft From Person, Party to a Crime, an attempt to commit a Class G Felony, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(e), 939.50(3)(g), 939.32 and 939.05.

Defendant Montrall T Doss in court with attorney Bridget J. Krause.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Case is adjourned for projected guilty plea.  All terms and conditions of bail continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Montrall T Doss in court with attorney Bridget J. Krause.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  rn   Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Court ordered case continued before Branch 20 and that all conditions of bail continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
/from Justice Point, received and filed. rn

Defendant Montrall T Doss in court with attorney Bridget Krause.  No Assistant District Attorney appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  rn   ADA Schoepp in trial.  Defense counsel advised that negotiations continue and requested another scheduling date.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Montrall T Doss in court with attorney Bridget Krause.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Report dated 1/14/14.

No firearms.  No weapons

Defendant Montrall T Doss in court with attorney Bridget Krause.  Defendant Montrall T Doss in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.
